text: Margaret Pomeranz (n√©e Jones-Owen; born 14 July 1944) is an Australian anti- censorship critic, television personality writer and She was held by police at the 2003 protest screening of the controversial movie Ken Park. The movie was banned in Australia due to its portraying underage sexual activity. Pomeranz had an uncredited role in the movie The Adventures of Priscilla, Queen of the Desert in 1994. Margaret Pomeranz was born in Waverley, a suburb of Sydney in New South Wales. ==References== Category:1944 births Category:Living people Category:Television personalities Category:Writers from New South Wales Category:Movie critics
title: Margaret Pomeranz
